com.projetloki.genesis

Class Transition

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projetloki.genesis.Transition

  • public final class Transition
extends Object
    Transitions, which are part of the CSS3 set of specifications, provide a way to control animation speed when changing CSS properties. Instead of having property changes take effect immediately, you can cause the changes in a property to take place over a period of time. For example, if you change the color of an element from white to black, usually the change is instantaneous. With CSS transitions enabled, changes occur at time intervals that follow an acceleration curve, all of which can be customized.

    Animations that involve transitioning between two states are often called implicit transitions as the states in between the start and final states are implicitly defined by the browser.

    Example: 

     void configure(CssBuilder out) {
   out.addRule(".box", Properties.builder()
       .setWidthPx(100)
       .setTransition(Transition.onProperty("width")
           .delaySeconds(0.5)
           .durationSeconds(3)));

   // When the pointing device is on the box, the box will grow
   // horizontally with a nice transition effect
   out.addRule(".box:hover", Properties.builder()
       .setWidthPx(200));
 }

    Transitions are immutable. Methods such as durationSeconds(double) perform a copy of the instance they are called on, modify the copy and return it. The original instance is left unchanged.

    Author:
    Cl√©ment Roux
    See Also:
    Animation, MDN, Browser support

    • Method Detail

      • onProperty

        public static Transition onProperty(String property)
        Returns a transition for the given CSS property. The delay and the duration are both zero (no animation occurs), and the timing function is ease.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given property is not a valid CSS identifier

      • durationSeconds

        public Transition durationSeconds(double seconds)
        Returns a new transition similar to this, with the duration property set to the given value. Specifies the time the transition animation should take to complete. Expressed in seconds.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the duration is negative
        See Also:
        MDN

      • timingFunction

        public Transition timingFunction(TimingFunction function)
        Returns a new transition similar to this, with the timing-function property set to the given value. Describe how the intermediate values of the CSS properties being affected by a transition effect are calculated.
        See Also:
        MDN

      • delaySeconds

        public Transition delaySeconds(double seconds)
        Returns a new transition similar to this, with the delay property set to the given value. Specifies the amount of time to wait between a change being requested to a property that is to be transitioned and the start of the transition effect. Expressed in seconds.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the duration is negative
        See Also:
        MDN
